elements.title: Episodes
elements.contents: ... that George Balanchine said that a solo in his ballet Episodes (pictured) should evoke the image of a fly in a glass of milk?

elements.title: L. J. Potts
elements.contents: ... that L. J. Potts translated the Poetics as Aristotle on the Art of Fiction, a title accused of "[narrowing] dangerously the wide gap between Aristotle and ourselves", but later called "creative genius"?

elements.title: Atlanta's "quicker picker-upper
elements.contents: ... that Atlanta's "quicker picker-upper" aired martial arts movies, professional wrestling, jazz music, and Japanese-language programming?

elements.title: Andrew Planta
elements.contents: ... that despite published scholarship to the contrary, Andrew Planta neither received a doctorate nor taught mathematics at Erlangen?

elements.title: Food Act 1984
elements.contents: ... that in November 2022, Leicester City Council used the Food Act 1984 in combination with a royal charter of 1199 to levy a charge on the organisers of two Christmas light switching-on events?

elements.title: Domen Križaj
elements.contents: ... that after Domen Križaj from Slovenia was a prize winner in the singing competition Neue Stimmen, he moved to the Oper Frankfurt where he appeared as Massenet's Albert and Mozart's Papageno?

elements.title: Manny's Deli
elements.contents: ... that Manny's Deli in Chicago received national recognition for its popularity among politicians, including Barack Obama?

elements.title: Claude C. Robinson
elements.contents: ... that Claude C. Robinson was supposed to pick the star-of-the-game, but he left early when struck in the head by a hockey puck?
